body.text: College of Community Innovation and Education

p.College of Community Innovation and Educ:
College of Community Innovation and Education
School of Teacher Education
Education Complex and Gym (ED), 209
407-823-5791
p.Associate Lecturer and Academic Program:
Associate Lecturer and Academic Program Coordinator: Dr. Taylar Wenzel
elemed@ucf.edu
p.The Elementary Education Professional St: The Elementary Education Professional Studies track is a non-certification track that is appropriate for students who wish to work with students in a traditional K-6 classroom setting, but have not passed the required exams to be admitted to and graduate in the K-6 Certification track. Students graduating in the Professional Studies track are not eligible for teaching certification from the Florida Department of Education upon graduation and will not earn the ESOL or Reading endorsements.

li.Complete the University General Educatio: Complete the University General Education requirements or its equivalent, i.e., an AA degree from an approved Florida College System or State University System institution.
li.Complete EDF 2005 Introduction to Teachi: Complete EDF 2005 Introduction to Teaching Profession course with a minimum letter grade of "C-" (1.75) or better.
li.Meet the Foreign Language Admission Requ: Meet the Foreign Language Admission Requirement.
li.Students should see an advisor prior to: Students should see an advisor prior to registering for classes.
li.The courses designated in 1 (UCF General: The courses designated in 1 (UCF General Education Program) and 2 (Education Common Program Prerequisites) should be completed prior to admission to the major and upper division education courses.

courseSection0.text:
College of Community Innovation and Education
School of Teacher Education
Education Complex and Gym (ED), 209
407-823-5791
Associate Lecturer and Academic Program Coordinator: Dr. Taylar Wenzel
elemed@ucf.edu
The Elementary Education Professional Studies track is a non-certification track that is appropriate for students who wish to work with students in a traditional K-6 classroom setting, but have not passed the required exams to be admitted to and graduate in the K-6 Certification track. Students graduating in the Professional Studies track are not eligible for teaching certification from the Florida Department of Education upon graduation and will not earn the ESOL or Reading endorsements.
Admission Requirements
Complete the University General Education requirements or its equivalent, i.e., an AA degree from an approved Florida College System or State University System institution.
Have a minimum 2.5 overall GPA.
Complete EDF 2005 Introduction to Teaching Profession course with a minimum letter grade of "C-" (1.75) or better.
Meet the Gordon Rule Requirement.
Meet the Foreign Language Admission Requirement.
Degree Requirements
Students should see an advisor prior to registering for classes.
The courses designated in 1 (UCF General Education Program) and 2 (Education Common Program Prerequisites) should be completed prior to admission to the major and upper division education courses.

text.College of Community Innovation and Educ: College of Community Innovation and Education

p.1 Courses taken at a Florida College Sys: 1 Courses taken at a Florida College System institution may substitute for select courses in Other Program Requirements with the permission of the department.

li.State University System foreign language: State University System foreign language admission requirement: two years in high school or one year of college instruction in a single foreign language. (This requirement applies to those students admitted to the University without the required two units of foreign language in high school.)
li.Achieve a minimum overall 2.5 GPA within: Achieve a minimum overall 2.5 GPA within the major.
li.Achieve a minimum 2.5 GPA in education c: Achieve a minimum 2.5 GPA in education core coursework.
li.Achieve a minimum 2.5 GPA in specializat: Achieve a minimum 2.5 GPA in specialization coursework.
li.You must upload key assignments using th: You must upload key assignments using the Via by Watermark platform. Key assignments are assessed by faculty to provide evidence of candidate proficiency in all Florida Educator Accomplished Practices (FEAPs). All teacher education candidates, Professional Studies majors, Lifelong Learning majors, and Early Childhood Development & Education majors (all ECDE tracks) are required to complete all Via requirements before being certified for graduation. See https://ccie.ucf.edu/explore-via/.
li.Complete ESOL standards assessment track: Complete ESOL standards assessment tracking requirements in the Via by Watermark platform for the ESOL endorsement.

courseSection3.text:
Foreign Language Requirements

Admissions
State University System foreign language admission requirement: two years in high school or one year of college instruction in a single foreign language. (This requirement applies to those students admitted to the University without the required two units of foreign language in high school.)
Graduation
None

courseSection6.text:
Departmental Exit Requirements

Achieve a minimum overall 2.5 GPA within the major.
Achieve a minimum 2.5 GPA in education core coursework.
Achieve a minimum 2.5 GPA in specialization coursework.
Achieve a minimum overall 2.5 GPA
You must upload key assignments using the Via by Watermark platform. Key assignments are assessed by faculty to provide evidence of candidate proficiency in all Florida Educator Accomplished Practices (FEAPs). All teacher education candidates, Professional Studies majors, Lifelong Learning majors, and Early Childhood Development & Education majors (all ECDE tracks) are required to complete all Via requirements before being certified for graduation. See https://ccie.ucf.edu/explore-via/.
Complete ESOL standards assessment tracking requirements in the Via by Watermark platform for the ESOL endorsement.

courseSection7.text:
University Minimum Exit Requirements

A 2.0 UCF GPA
42 semester hours of upper division credit completed
60 semester hours earned after CLEP awarded
30 of the last 39 hours of course work must be completed in residency at UCF.
A maximum of 45 hours of extension, correspondence, CLEP, Credit by Exam, and Armed Forces credits permitted.
Complete the General Education Program, the Gordon Rule, and nine hours of Summer credit.
